bind.jr:constraintMsg: Only dates in the past are allowed.
Total amount of land used for farming / crop production cannot exceed the total amount of land you own, use or operate on.

input.label: House Location:
Village Code:
Homestead Number:
Household Number:
Interviewer Name:
Interviewer, please read the "Informed Consent Statement" to the interviewee.
Do you have any questions about the purpose or content of this interview?

select1.label: May I begin the interview now?
Interviewer, do you confirm that the "Informed Consent Statement" has been read to the interviewee and that he/she understands and consents to participate in the interview?

input.label: Name of Main Respondent:
What is the ethnicity of the household head?
Name of Household Member:

select1.label: What is 's sex?

input.label: What is 's date of birth?
What is 's age in completed years?

select1.label: What is 's relation to the household head?
What is 's marital status?
What is 's orphan status?

item.label: Double orphan (both father and mother deceased)

input.label: How many months has lived in the house over the last 12 months?

select1.label: Has ever attended school or pre-school?
What is the highest level attended?

input.label: What is the highest class or form completed at this level?

select1.label: Did attend school or pre-school at any time during the current school year?
During the current school year, what level did attend?

input.label: During the current school year, what class did attend?

select1.label: Did attend school or pre-school at any time during the previous school year?
During the previous school year, what level did attend?

input.label: During the previous school year, what class did attend?

select1.label: What is the main reason is not attending school?

item.label: Illness or disability / sick or disabled
Can't afford school costs (i.e. uniforms, books, school supplies, transportation costs, or all costs)
School too far from home / long distance to school
Problems with travel to school (i.e. lack of transport, it is unsafe to travel to school)
Problems with the school or school quality (i.e. crowded classrooms, inadequate or poor buildings, lack of clean/private sanitary facilities, lack of furniture or supplies)
Problems with teacher quality (i.e. poor quality of instruction / teacher absenteeism / lack of female teachers)
Needed to do domestic work at home (such as caring for younger children / elderly / sick relatives; cooking or cleaning; fetching water or wood)
Needed to tend animals or work on the family farm or family business
Needed to work for an employer
Got married / got pregnant / made someone pregnant
School conflict with religious / personal beliefs, or cultural practices
Parents feel child is too young to go to school
Acquired education wanted / no need for further schooling
Not interested in school / school not important
Lack of job opportunities for school graduates
Just finished / waiting for results / failed national exam

input.label: Now, I would like to talk to you about mosquito nets used to help prevent malaria.

select1.label: Does your household have any mosquito nets that can be used while sleeping?

input.label: How many functioning mosquito nets does your household have? [FUNCTIONING: NO MAJOR DAMAGE OR LARGE HOLES]
What room or bed is the net located?
Ask the respondent to show you the nets in the household.
How long ago did your household obtain this net?
OBSERVE OR ASK THE BRAND / TYPE OF NET

select1.label: Has the net ever been treated (or pre-treated) with insecticide?

input.label: When was the last time it was treated?

select1.label: Did anyone sleep under this mosquito net last night?

input.label: Who slept under this mosquito net last night? IF VISITOR SLEPT UNDER NET, THEN WRITE ‘VISITOR’ FOR NAME AND ‘90’ FOR LINE NUMBER.
Now, I would like to talk to you about your land ownership and management.
What is the total amount of land you own, use or operate on? [-90 = Don’t Know]

select1.label: DID RESPONDENT REPORT HECTARES OR ACRES IN THE PREVIOUS QUESTION?

input.label: Now, I would like to talk about the land that you have used during the most recent major and minor seasons.

select1.label: From [SPECIFY START and END MONTHS for BOTH MAJOR & MINOR CROPPING SEASONS - 12 CONSECUTIVE MONTHS], did you use any land for farming / crop production ?
IF ‘NO’, PROBE: “Just to make sure that I have this right: You did not use any land for farming. Is that correct?”

input.label: From [SPECIFY START and END MONTHS for BOTH MAJOR & MINOR CROPPING SEASONS - 12 CONSECUTIVE MONTHS], what is the total amount of land you used for farming / crop production?

select1.label: DID RESPONDENT REPORT HECTARES OR ACRES IN THE PREVIOUS QUESTION?

group.label: Major Cropping Season - Agricultural Crop / Plant Harvest

input.label: Now, I would like to talk to you about agricultural production. Please list all the major crops harvested in the past major cropping season. Do not list very minor enterprises, such as a couple of plants of a spice for home consumption.

select1.label: Did you harvest any crops / plants from…to…[SPECIFY START and END MONTHS for MOST RECENT COMPLETED MAJOR CROPPING SEASON]? [NOTE: “MAJOR” SEASON TYPICALLY REFERS TO THE “LONG RAINY” SEASON]

input.label: What were the most important crops / plants that you harvested from…to…[MONTHS IN Q203]? ...Anything else? [LIST NAMES OF UP TO THE 10 MAJOR HARVESTED CROPS / PLANTS IN 203.B à THEN THE CORRESPONDING CODE IN 203.C à THEN COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS FOR EACH CROP / PLANT]
Name Of Crop / Plant (Major Season)

select1.label: Crop / Plant Code (Major Season)

item.label: VEGETABLES: Oseille de Guinée (Dah Rouge) / Hibiscus sabdariffa
TREES: Soil fertility and conservation trees

input.label: What is the estimated quantity of [CROP] harvests for the entire household from…to [MONTHS IN Q203]?

select1.label: Units

input.label: How much land area was used for this [CROP] harvest? [-90 = DK]

select1.label: DID RESPOND-ENT REPORT HECTARES OR ACRES?

input.label: If you were to sell one [UNIT in Q204.E] of [CROP], how much would you get for it? [Local Currency, -90 = DK]

group.label: Minor Cropping Season - Agricultural Crop / Plant Harvest

select1.label: From…to… [SPECIFY 12 MONTH CONSECUTIVE PERIOD FOR THE MOST RECENT COMPLETED MAJOR AND MINOR SEASONS], did you use any agricultural inputs, such as chemical fertilizer, organic fertilizer, improved seeds, local seeds, or pesticides, for farming?

input.label: What types of inputs did you use for farming? …..Anything else? [LIST ALL THE AGRICULTURAL INPUTS IN 210.B à THEN ENTER THE CODE IN 210.C AND COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS FOR EACH INPUT]
Name Of Farm Input

select1.label: Input Code

input.label: How much of this [INPUT] was used from…to…[MONTHS IN Q210]? Quantity / Amounts # [IF ‘DON’T KNOW’ THEN CODE ‘-90’]

select1.label: Unit
213: Procured from:

item.label: Purchased using a loan provided by MVP
Own resources (e.g. seeds or fertilizer from previous year)
Purchased using a loan provided by another entity

select1.label: What is the primary crop or agricultural activity that is supported with this [INPUT]?

item.label: VEGETABLES: Oseille de Guinée (Dah Rouge) / Hibiscus sabdariffa
TREES: Soil fertility and conservation trees

select1.label: What is the secondary crop or agricultural activity that is supported with this [INPUT]?

item.label: VEGETABLES: Oseille de Guinée (Dah Rouge) / Hibiscus sabdariffa
TREES: Soil fertility and conservation trees

input.label: Now I would like to ask you about your household’s food, water, and energy supply during different months of the year. When responding to these questions, please think back over the last 12 months.

select1.label: In the past 12 months, were there months in which you did not have enough food to meet your family’s needs?

select.label: Which were the months (in the past 12 months) in which you did not have enough food to meet your family’s needs?

select1.label: Thank you very much for your time and patience. We have completed a little more than half of the survey. Would you like to continue answering questions now (Yes) or reschedule the interview for another time (No)?

input.label: IF RESCHEDULING: “What is a good day and time to return?
Now, I would like to talk to you about loans, remittances, and other assistance. Please remember this information is confidential and you can refuse to answer any question.

select1.label: Has any member of this household received credit, loan, or payment-plan in the past 12 months?

input.label: What is the total value of credit, loans, or payment-plans received during the past 12 months by all the household members combined? Cash amount [-90 = Don’t Know -80 = Refused to answer]

select.label: What source(s) provided the credit, loans, or payment-plans?
What is the purpose of these credit, loans, or payment-plans?

select1.label: Does any member of your household have a bank account?
During the past 12 months, did any member of your household deposit money into the bank account(s)?

input.label: Now, I would like to ask you about the construction of your home. [NOTE: ENUMERATOR MAY OBSERVE THE CONDITION OF THE HOUSE AND RECORD ANSWER WITHOUT ASKING THE RESPONDENT]

select1.label: What is the main material of the wall of your house?
What is the main material of the floor of your house?
What is the main roofing material of your house?
What type of windows (if any) does your house have?

input.label: How many bedrooms does your main house have?

select1.label: Do you or any of your household members’ own this main house?
Do you or any of your household members’ own any other home(s)?

input.label: How many other homes do you or your household members own?

Now I would like to talk to you about your household assets. Please answer ‘Yes’ if you own any of the following items, unless the item does not currently work / function. Please include only assets that are owned by your household members and not those assets owned by other homestead members.

select.label: Do you own any of the following:

item.label: Any other motor vehicle (car, truck, bus, etc.)

input.label: How many Kerosene Lamp do you own?
How many Battery Torch / Lamp do you own?
How many Radio do you own?
How many Tape Recorder / Cassette Player do you own?
How many Cell phone do you own?
How many Landline telephone into household do you own?
How many Wall Clock / Watch do you own?
How many Television do you own?
How many Refrigerator do you own?
How many Animal-drawn cart (wheels) do you own?
How many Bicycle do you own?
How many Motorcycle or scooter do you own?
How many Any other motor vehicle (car, truck, bus, etc.) do you own?
If you sold all of the Kerosene Lamp you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Battery Torch / Lamp you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Radio you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Tape Recorder / Cassette Player you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Cell phone you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Landline telephone into household you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Wall Clock / Watch you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Television you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Refrigerator you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Animal-drawn cart (wheels) you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Bicycle you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Motorcycle or scooter you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
If you sold all of the Any other motor vehicle (car, truck, bus, etc.) you own, how much money would you receive (in local currency)?
Now I would like to talk to you about your livestock.

select1.label: During the past 12 months, have you owned any livestock?

input.label: Please list the most valuable types of livestock that you own. Please include only livestock that are owned by your household members and not those livestock owned by other homestead members.
Type Of Livestock
Code
How many [TYPE OF LIVESTOCK] do you own? (DK = -90)
If you were to sell one [TYPE OF LIVESTOCK], how much would you get for it? (Local Currency DK = -90)

group.label: Animal-Based Products Harvested In The Past 12 Months

select1.label: Now, I would like to talk to you about animal-based products, such as milk, eggs, honey, manure, etc. This does not include whole animal selling, such as selling cows, chickens, goats, etc. In Past 12 Months, did you produce any animal-based products?

input.label: In Past 12 Months, what animal-based products did you produce? …Anything else? [LIST ALL THE ANIMAL PRODUCT NAMES IN 347.B à THEN THE CORRESPONDING CODE IN 347.C à THEN COMPLETE THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS FOR EACH ANIMAL PRODUCT.]
NAME OF ANIMAL PRODUCT

select1.label: ANIMAL PRODUCT CODE

input.label: What is the estimated quantity of [PRODUCT] harvests for the entire household in the past 12 months? (-90 = DK)

select1.label: Units

Now, I would like to talk with you about your household’s energy and water use. If someone else in the household is the primary person responsible for fetching fuel or water, would it be possible for them to join the interview?
Do you or any household members cook meals at home?

What is your household’s primary type of energy / fuel used for cooking household meals? [NOTE: THIS DOES NOT INCLUDE COOKING FOR SELLING OR INCOME GENERATION.] [NOTE: “PRIMARY TYPE” MEANS MOST NUMBER OF MEALS COOKED.]

item.label: Solar Heater or Cooker / Solar Thermal

select1.label: What is the primary source for this energy / fuel?

item.label: Other land / trees / field owned by household
Obtained by exchange for other items (but not purchased)
Produced by household (e.g. biogas, sawdust; NOT firewood)
Waste from non-farm work (e.g. carpentry, building, etc.)

input.label: What is the distance in meters from your household to that fuel source? (meters, -90 = Don’t know)
How long does it take to go there, get fuel, and come back? (minutes, -90 = Don't Know)
During a normal week, how many hours are spent gathering this type of energy / fuel? (hours, -90=don't know)
Who is the primary household member(s) responsible for gathering this type of energy / fuel?

item.label: Mix of female and male children
Mix of female and male adults
Shared among all household members (combination of adults and children)

input.label: During a normal week, how many trips do the primary household member(s) go to collect this type of energy / fuel? (-90 = Don't Know)

select1.label: What is the primary energy source that your household uses for lighting?

input.label: In a normal week, how many hours of lighting does your household use from this primary source? (-90 = Don’t Know)
Now, I would like to talk to you about water use.

select1.label: What is the main source of drinking-water for members of your household?

item.label: Surface water (river, dam, lake, pond, stream, canal, irrigation channels)

select1.label: Where is that water source located?

input.label: What is the distance in meters from your household to that water source? (-90 = Don’t know)
How long does it take to go there, get water, and come back? (Minutes, -90 = Don't Know)

select1.label: Who usually goes to this source to fetch the water for your household?

item.label: Mix of male and female children
Mix of male and female adults
Shared among all household members (combination of adults and children)

select1.label: Is that drinking-water source the primary source during the dry season, wet season, or both seasons?

input.label: Now, I would like to talk to you about water treatment.

select1.label: Do you treat your water in any way to make it safer to drink?

select.label: What do you usually do to the water to make it safer to drink?

item.label: Use a water filter (ceramic, sand, composite, etc.)

input.label: Now, I would like to talk to you about sanitation and hygiene.

select1.label: What kind of toilet facility do members of your household usually use?

item.label: Flush to unknown place / not sure / don’t know
Pit latrine without slab / open pit
No facilities or bush or field 400

select1.label: Do you share this facility with other households?

input.label: How many households use this toilet facility? (-90 = Don’t Know)
